comment.author: 82214664@N00
comment._content: It couldn't have taken too many years to realize that this was a stupid, (as well as unsightly), way to prune trees.

comment.author: 15937237@N00
comment._content: Thanks for the link to the blog. I wonder if that (church?) tower in the background is still around?

comment.author: 27815505@N02
comment._content: it looks to be the Asbury United Methodist Church at 11th and K NW. Can't be sure though.

comment.author: 27815505@N02
comment._content: actually they still do that in Europe and while they may look unsightly during the winter months, it makes for a much more symetrical tree when the leaves are out.  Google some Paris avenue pictures and you'll see what I mean.  Also supposedly it significantly extends the life of the trees.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Lance, I looked at google street maps and they do look similar, but hard to tell for sure. I will send along your feedback to our archivist on staff. Cheers, Effie
